title: Two charged with murder in fatal drive-by
content:
Two men have been charged with murder in a drive-by shooting that left a 6-year-old boy dead and his 11-year-old brother injured, police said Thursday.
Houston police identified the men as Oscar Ollervides, 20, and Alexis Arturo Cuapio, 24. Another person is being questioned in the shooting, police said.
Police said the gunmen were retaliating against the boys' other brothers.
On Sept. 25, at around 3:50 a.m., a car pulled up outside a house on Narcissus near Flowers.
The occupants fired 14 shots into the home, killing Moises Jimenez as he slept in his bed. His 11-year-old brother, Manuel, was taken to Ben Taub General Hospital. He is still recovering from his injuries.
The two children attended nearby Southmayd Elementary School. Moises had recently started first-grade and his brother is a fifth-grader, family said.
The boys were in their beds when a dark sedan drove past the house and someone inside opened fire, said Sgt. Steven Murdock, an HPD homicide investigator. The gunshots crashed through a window and ripped through a wall. Several members of the boys' family were inside the home at the time of the shooting.
Murdock has said the shooting may be gang- or drug-related. Officers have been called to the home several other times for incidents, though Murdock did not elaborate about those emergency calls for service. He also did not discuss evidence that led investigators to believe drugs or gangs may be connected to the shooting.
Police released surveillance images of a truck and sedan seen in the area at the time of the shooting.
